title: (x) Serif face used on Hiroshi Sugimoto homepage - Simoncini Garamond {Akira}
content:
Trying to I.D the serif used on Hiroshi Sugimoto’s homepage

[http://www.sugimotohiroshi.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328225750/http:/www.sugimotohiroshi.com/ "http://www.sugimotohiroshi.com/")

It seems to light to be apollo, and finding it hard to decipher as the serifs are being lost amongst the pixels.

It’s probably something easy ;)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [5.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328225750/http:/typophile.com/files/5_2.jpg) | 11.03 KB |

 [‹ (x) Fast Company logo and cover titles - custom drawn, Benton Sans {Yves, Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328225750/http:/typophile.com/node/43592 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "hypotheken beleggingen" modern italic - FF Quadraat {Richard Welker} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080328225750/http:/typophile.com/node/31528 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Sebastian Ziegler

comments.content: Yes, I think your right. Have you used it before? Or how did you figure it out?

\> _Have you used it before? Or how did you figure it out?_

Naw, Akira is just one motha of a shithot type identifier. He’s one of the rulers of this Board.
